isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - STOPMASTER WEDGE TYPE BRAKE - INSTALL - AIR CHAMBER

svcproc.title: AIR CHAMBER

step1.para: Check position of the wedge in plunger housing to make certain wedge assembly is properly seated. Then, thread collet nut onto air chamber tube. Be sure to replace automatic adjusting identification ring (if used) on air chamber tube.

svcproc.para: Figure 43illustrates the position of the collet (lock) nut when the brake spider has a conical counter bore.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Position of Collet (Lock) Nut on Spider With Counter Bore

svcproc.para: Figure 44illustrates the position of the collet, (lock) nut and retainer when the spider does not have the conical counter bore.

figure.caption: Figure 44. Position of Collet (Lock) Nut and Retainer on Spider Without Counter Bore

step1.para: Apply a non-hardening sealer to the first three threads of the chamber tube.
Thread the chamber into the plunger housing unit until it bottoms (collet (lock) nut loose).
Align service chamber ports by either of the following:

step2.para: Back off chamber no more than one turn to proper location.
Loosen clamp ring and rotate pressure housing to proper location. Retighten clamp.

step1.para: Make and hold a full brake application. Then, hand tighten collet (lock) nut.
Tighten collet (lock) nut with a drift and hammer 1-1/2 teeth (or 3/16 turn), minimum of 125 ft-lbs. (170 N•m) and release brake pressure.
Check for leaks at all connections.
Uncage spring brake unit before returning vehicle to service. Refer to CAGING AND UNCAGING SPRING BRAKE.
